name: places/ChIJHwYuvRxZwokR2Q83DZefBUk
formattedAddress: 1 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 United Nations Plaza, New York, NY 10017, USA

editorialSummary.text: White-tablecloth choice in the UN offering prix-fixe lunches of global fare & panoramic river views.

originalText.text: Such an amazing experience! Dining here for lunch was a highlight of our visit to New York. The views are spectacular and the location within the United Nations is very, very cool.

text.text: Such an amazing experience! Dining here for lunch was a highlight of our visit to New York. The views are spectacular and the location within the United Nations is very, very cool.

originalText.text: Great place to connect at the UN if you know anyone there. Security is kinda tight, considering it's the UN. Drinks are fairly bad. Food too, but the space is gorgeous. The UN is full of artifacts from around the world. They're mostly gifts from member countries and they kind of give the place its historic vibe. The UN itself is rather young, but there's a thousand years of culture in it.

text.text: Great place to connect at the UN if you know anyone there. Security is kinda tight, considering it's the UN. Drinks are fairly bad. Food too, but the space is gorgeous. The UN is full of artifacts from around the world. They're mostly gifts from member countries and they kind of give the place its historic vibe. The UN itself is rather young, but there's a thousand years of culture in it.

originalText.text:
The experience overall seemed unprofessional and haphazard. We were first escorted to the security office across the street where the attendants took our picture and copied our IDs. They gave us sticker name tags to wear inside the UN, and got both of our names wrong, despite the fact that had our IDs. At the end of the visit they berated my friend for taking a name tag that didn't have her name on it. That's your incompetence problem, not ours.

The Delegates Dining room is unadorned and looks a bit like a wedding reception room, despite the fact that the rest of the UN that I've seen is beautiful. The food was okay, the dessert was definitely the highlight of the meal. It is a buffet style meal, so I guess you could say you can get your moneys worth if you want to eat a ton of food. Our server refused to take a photo of us when I asked, saying it was against the rules, but later we asked another server, who took it. I don't really understand their policy on photo taking, Overall the servers were very informal and were joking around with each other. We were hoping to meet people at the UN who were actually excited to be there and were proud of working for the UN. The only person who really fit the bill was our guide to and from the Delegates Dining Room. But when we were waiting for him to escort us back from the lunch, he took too long, like 10 minutes, and a security officer escorted us the rest of the way.

originalText.text:
Classy lunch service with world class buffet (or order from a menu) in White table cloth space overlooking panoramic view of the East River. There is a dress code. Superb, attentive yet unobtrusive, service.
Must make advance registration and go through security check. Allow additional time. The dining room may get closed to visitors during special UN events or emergencies.
Additional space around the dining room may be reserved for large groups or events for lunch or other gatherings.
During General Assembly, many special events are held here which close it to visitors.
Extra effort to make it here at least once is worth it.

originalText.text: It's restricted zone. Employees and those with proper ID card issued by UN organisation are can enter into inside the premises. Superb architecture and paintings can see inside. Food at affordable price available. We have to according to item and it's weight. I beside Hudson river. We can enjoy river side view. It's very nice see most of the city's skyline buildings. Only issue is unbearable chilled weather. We have to wear thermals and proper jackets and hand gloves to care our ourselves
